meta.title: Biology MCQs - Cell Structure and Function
meta.description: Practice questions on the fundamental concepts of cell structure and function.
meta.keywords: biology, mcqs, quiz, cell, cell structure, cell function, organelles, prokaryotic, eukaryotic

questions.q: Which of the following is common to both prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells?
questions.ex: Ribosomes are essential for protein synthesis and are found in both prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells. The others are features of eukaryotic cells.

questions.q: The primary function of the cell membrane is:
questions.ex: The cell membrane is a selectively permeable barrier that regulates what enters and leaves the cell.

questions.q: Which organelle is responsible for generating most of the cell's supply of ATP?
questions.ex: Mitochondria are known as the 'powerhouses of the cell' because they carry out cellular respiration to produce ATP.

questions.q: The site of protein synthesis in a cell is the:
questions.ex: Ribosomes are responsible for translating mRNA into protein sequences, thus synthesizing proteins.

questions.q: Which of the following structures is found in plant cells but not animal cells?
questions.ex: Plant cells have a rigid cell wall outside the cell membrane, which is absent in animal cells.

questions.q: What is the function of the smooth endoplasmic reticulum?
questions.ex: The smooth ER is involved in the synthesis of lipids, metabolism of carbohydrates, detoxification of drugs and poisons, and storage of calcium ions.

questions.q: The packaging and modification of proteins and lipids occur in which organelle?
questions.ex: The Golgi apparatus modifies, sorts, and packages proteins and lipids for secretion or delivery to other organelles.

questions.q: Which organelle contains digestive enzymes and is responsible for breaking down waste materials and cellular debris?
questions.ex: Lysosomes are membrane-bound organelles containing hydrolytic enzymes that break down various biomolecules.

questions.q: The control center of a eukaryotic cell is the:
questions.ex: The nucleus houses the cell's genetic material (DNA) and controls cell growth and reproduction.
